title: Bohan
html: BOHAN(Boʹhan) [possibly, Thumb].1. A descendant of Reuben after whom a boundary stone for the territory of Judah was named.—Jos 15:6; 18:17.2. “The stone of Bohan” served as a boundary marker for the tribes of Benjamin and Judah. (Jos 15:6; 18:17) It lay near the NW corner of the Salt Sea and evidently toward the foot of the plateaulike Low Plain of Achor.
